articles.title: Why tipping in the United States has gotten out of hand - CNBC
articles.description: Tipping in the United States is on the rise to such a degree that experts call it "tipflation." The social pressure to tip well in front of the tip receiver, before a service is completed, or in front of other customers, encourages the trend, and the pandemic…

articles.title: S.F. homeowner still awaiting PG&E upgrade for all-electric appliances - San Francisco Chronicle
